scene.sceneheader: SCENE I. A room in the castle.
scene.stagedirect: Enter KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, ROSENCRANTZ, and GUILDENSTERN

verse.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
verse.dialogue: There's matter in these sighs, these profound heaves: You must translate: 'tis fit we understand them. Where is your son?

verse.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
verse.dialogue: Bestow this place on us a little while.
Ah, my good lord, what have I seen to-night!

verse.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
verse.dialogue: Mad as the sea and wind, when both contend Which is the mightier: in his lawless fit, Behind the arras hearing something stir, Whips out his rapier, cries, 'A rat, a rat!' And, in this brainish apprehension, kills The unseen good old man.

verse.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
verse.dialogue: O heavy deed! It had been so with us, had we been there: His liberty is full of threats to all; To you yourself, to us, to every one. Alas, how shall this bloody deed be answer'd? It will be laid to us, whose providence Should have kept short, restrain'd and out of haunt, This mad young man: but so much was our love, We would not understand what was most fit; But, like the owner of a foul disease, To keep it from divulging, let it feed Even on the pith of Life. Where is he gone?

verse.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
verse.dialogue: To draw apart the body he hath kill'd: O'er whom his very madness, like some ore Among a mineral of metals base, Shows itself pure; he weeps for what is done.

verse.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
verse.dialogue: O Gertrude, come away! The sun no sooner shall the mountains touch, But we will ship him hence: and this vile deed We must, with all our majesty and skill, Both countenance and excuse. Ho, Guildenstern!

Friends both, go join you with some further aid: Hamlet in madness hath Polonius slain, And from his mother's closet hath he dragg'd him: Go seek him out; speak fair, and bring the body Into the chapel. I pray you, haste in this.
Come, Gertrude, we'll call up our wisest friends; And let them know, both what we mean to do, And what's untimely done. O, come away! My soul is full of discord and dismay.
